result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leshawn B Brooks

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court, defendant Leshawn B Brooks not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM.  Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense requests a new date.  Court set a plea/sentencing date.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in Room 503 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Megan Kaldunski in court, defendant Leshawn B Brooks not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Parties are still in negotiations and are requesting a Projected Guilty Plea date. Court grants request and further accepts transfer of case 21CF1514 from Br 35 for global resolution. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  Filings Due scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Leshawn B Brooks in court with Attorney Megan Kaldunski.  Defendant Leshawn B Brooks in custody appearance waived.  John J Rejowski for Amy Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail review.  The bail review was held via zoom.   For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS defense motion for bail reduction.  Defense requests  Status date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Leshawn B Brooks in court with Attorney Megan Kaldunski; both appear by video.  Defendant Leshawn B Brooks in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 21CF4051 & 21CF1514. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Deputy D. Walton. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER - ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL

Defendant Leshawn B Brooks not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leshawn B Brooks not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Leshawn B Brooks in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Leshawn B Brooks in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Leshawn B Brooks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
